meanings.definition: To cause to cease burning or to put out (a fire, light, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The firefighter was extinguishing the flames with water.
meanings.sent2: She quickly grabbed the fire extinguisher to start extinguishing the fire.
meanings.sent3: The birthday candles were no match for the extinguishing power of the wind.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking was like extinguishing a dangerous situation before it spread.
meanings.sent5: The rain poured down, extinguishing the campfire completely.

meanings.definition: To bring to an end or to make disappear
meanings.sent1: The magician performed a trick, seemingly extinguishing the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent2: The detective was close to extinguishing all doubts about the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent3: Her laughter was so contagious, it seemed to be extinguishing all sadness in the room.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly setting was like extinguishing the day, giving way to the night.
meanings.sent5: With a wave of his hand, the wizard was extinguishing the memory of the troublesome spell.
